posts.author: Frodo88
posts.content:
Hi,

first time poster - after some help/ideas to optimise this build. Was thinking 27 cleric /7 wm / 6 monk

will be duel dwarven war axes due to the server (amazing crit axe) - restriction on dev crit so not trying for that.

pvm so not fussed on pvp although playable 1-40 helps. Therefore don't want to deal with lower exp for cross class due to wrong race. (Went human)

i made a test char and took 12/13 cleric then all WM levels followed by monk to get full tumble and improved knockdown and ac bonus.

need improved two weapon fighting as well so I started stats with:

str - 12
dex - 15
con - 10
wiz - 16
cha - 8 

any help around level progression and feat selection would assist. I took epic Str for normal epic feats and cleric bonus epic wis - ended up with 25 Str and 25 wis base from memory.

thanks

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Going for WM with no Fighter or CoT will make the build feat-starved, especially with dual-wielding added, and then yet another feat for Exotic Weapons. If you use any weapon other than kamas, you will lose the Monk's attack progression, so you get two fewer attacks per round. My suggestions: either replace Monk with Fighter or replace dwarven waraxes with kamas.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Welcome to the guild!  We are happy you decided to join our group and hope your stay is profitable and interesting.

Just a few quick points to ruminate over...
  • Am assuming you set you INT at 14.  A starting spread of STR14-DEX15-CON10-WIS15-INT14-CHA is more economical.  Using your current split and applying either Great STR or Great WIS for all epic feats will only net STR22/WIS25 and even that is impractical.  You are going to need at least EWF and Armor Skin and possibly even Epic Prowess (the same AB in one feat as from 2 Grt STRs).  Why so much Wisdom?
  • Any more than 24 levels of cleric is unnecessary as far as having your buffs dispelled.  Only mords will dispel a cleric 24 or higher.  Cleric 26 buys you a bonus feat but Clc 27 accomplishes little.
  • You'll lose monk AC and WIS AC unless you wear robes.  Is that what you were planning to equip?
  • Dual waraxes will not get monk -3 BAB progression.  They'll use the standard -5 attack sequence.
  • Maximizing pre-epic BAB at 15 exploits Divine Power.  Anything over that neutralizes the main benefits.  You'll need to postpone at least 1 WM level until epic to accomplish that.
  • Are you willing to wait until Level 37 to get KD/IKD?  That's what it will take to get the full Tumble benefit from 6 monk levels. A spread of Clc26/Mnk7/WM7 makes that unnecessary since you can take Monk 6 much earlier.
  • Any aspirations towards Overwhelming Crit or are you satisfied with the monk's free Cleave? 
  • I am also assuming you are fine with the -4/-4 AB penalty using the dual waraxes. Just checking.
  • Are you planning to invest into any metamagic like Extend Spell and Empower Spell?  If not, some of your crucial divine buffs will be relatively short-lived or less than optimized.
  • What domains have you considered?  Trickery seems automatic for a melee toon but Travel is not needed if there are permahaste properties around the server.
  • How high are the magical enhancements in the environment?  Typically, self-buffers lose much of their potency when the enhancements surpass the +5 milestone.
edit:
Here is a visual aid as to why this sort of combination is never used in serious environments with challenging encounters and optimized creature AI:
Spoiler [+]

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
If you have to take 4 pre-epic feats in epic levels, that is a sign that you are trying to cram too much into one build. I stand by my earlier suggestion for Fighter instead of Monk.

Here is Hip's build with a few tweaks and a couple major changes: DEX instead of STR and kamas instead of dwarven waraxes: It is slightly less awful, but it is still bad because Monk / Cleric / WM is a bad idea. This build has better AC and more health, but it still has the awful 35 AB, unbuffed.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Yeah, this concept is definitely like trying to pour a quart into a pint-sized container. It can be filled up alright but leave a real mess in its wake.  A good example of an exercise in futility.

The WM class requires so many prereqs that unless you are prepared to focus on AB (and ideally, on DevCrit), that attractive crit range and multiplier is simply not worth it.  A player needs to start tallying the number of crit immune races populating the environment and be sensible as to how much benefit can be gained statistically by investing in feats that will never help against those.  It sure isn't going to help while wandering through the crypts or the fire lair.  Besides those shortcomings, most bosses have an AC so high they'll bypass the threat roll of a pedestrian attack like this one.  In low-to-mid magic realms, the divine buffs will hold pretty reliably and reaching the AB cap can turn a bad base AB into a competitive threat.  But that tactic relies on a conducive resting policy (just like any other spellcaster does), especially on long dungeon crawls with lots of respawns.  Cleric levels can solve many issues but can't compensate for all weaknesses.

I remember a ways back someone proposed a finesse build using dual katanas (apparently the samarai fad was in full blossom then) when I and others commented about what constitutes a viable weapon for finessing.  The server must have customized katanas to not only be finesse-able but count as a light off-hand weapon for medium races.  Now if the dwarven waraxes are customized in a similar fashion...

...but that still wouldn't take advantage of the sweet monk progression laying there to be snatched up.  It's still just kamas or unarmed if you want to dance like a monk.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I tried to build something with these 3 classes and ended up with a feat starved "econo-cleric"/ morning-star master without dual-wield, and monk only for tumble dumps, cleave and evasion: Cl 15/ M 3/ WM 22. The AB is fairly good; 43, and becomes great once you buff up with cleric spells. But it has become something completely different than what the OP asked for.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: That's more like it, Mick.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Sure Hip, the build is far from a "polished" build for the lvl 40 section, and it is still feat starved, even after dropping the TWF feats!
I'd also like to add IKD, Empower, Blind fight and WP martial, but there is no room here if you want to qualify for WM, unless you start sacrificing great strength feats.
You are right about taking 6 levels of monk, it can be done at a fair price, but regrettably IKD comes very late.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
HipRedux wrote:
slightly better Fort and Will with 3 more monk levels during epic.
I think that what classes you take in epic has no effect on your saves (except CoT).
